pages.title: About Me
pages.content:
Hi I’m Karl!

Based in the wirral, I’m an ambitious and passionate backend developer with a keen desire to continuously expand and improve my skill set. I strive to build systems to positively impact clients businesses as well as expand mine and my teams knowledge of the subject. I understand that the best software is built by teams, and team-work s good interpersonal skills as well as a technical frame of mind. I consider myself to be friendly and outgoing. A keen learner, I’m enthusiastic to learn new technologies, frameworks and languages.

pages.title: Gene Commerce
pages.content:
Since I’ve joined gene commerce, exclusively a Magento agency, I’ve worked on a number of different projects, largely as support but with a couple of new builds, Tommee Tippee AU & Case Luggage.

Due to the way the company is organised, having software architects, most of the extensions built are done to exact specifications - For example for a Price Rule module which, hooking in through an observer, changes the price of products depending on custom attributes received through a 3rd party system.

pages.title: Yoma
pages.content:
In 2018 I left reading room due to the lack of incoming work over a 3 month period, and joined Yoma as a full-stack developer.

The lead developer and I worked on a boilerplate system, integrating Wordpress (with Advanced Custom Fields) and Magento 2, to help speed up the development process. Compared to my previous job I also had to do a lot more heavy lifting on the frontend, where I became familiar with LESS / SASS, Gulp & RequireJS.

pages.title: Rippleffect / ReadingRoom
pages.content:
I joined Rippleffect as a Magento Developer, as the company was being taken over by ReadingRoom. Having learned Magento2 in the latter part of my previous job. Here I was tasked with maintaining numerous Magento 1 & 2 sites - LFC store, funkin’ cocktails, stoke fc - building new features and fixing existing issues.

I worked on stokes custom touch retail integration, including additional data in magento 2’s REST API to suit the clients requirements. Most notably I worked on the Ipswich Town FC new build, adding additional backend features to suit requirements as well as porting over the ‘kitbuilder’ a football shirt configurator.

I expanded my skill set here, adopting new tools such as Bitbucket/Github, Vagrant, XDebug & Docker.

pages.title: The Farm Factory
pages.content:
In 2012 I joined the company as an apprentice and quickly progressed into a full-stack developer role. Expanding on my existing experience from college I became proficient in HTML & CSS, as well as becoming familiar with a number of popular CMS’s, such as WordPress, Joomla & Magento.

Along with learning these systems I expanded my skill set by incorporating Javascript, PHP & MySQL. I also gained familiarity with composer and dependency management in general, linux and SSH.

From here I started taking the lead on projects such as new builds, upgrades, scoping projects and designing custom extensions for sites - leading me to see a project through from design to reality. This job saw me progress from a novice to senior developer, and eventually lead.
